item.title: I Went to an AI Film Festival Screening and Left With More Questions Than Answers
item.description: Runway AI paired up with Imax to screen 10 AI-generated winning selections. The festival has been derided by some cinephiles, while others insist it’s part of a natural technological evolution.

item.title: AI Isn’t Coming for Hollywood. It Has Already Arrived
item.description: An early winner in the generative AI wars was near collapse—then bet everything on a star-studded comeback. Can Stability AI beat the competition?

item.title: 'War of the Worlds' Isn’t Just Bad. It’s Also Shameless Tech Propaganda
item.description: By making Big Tech the hero in a movie about government surveillance, the dismally rated remake feels more like an ad for Amazon than anything else.

item.title: 'Eddington' Director Ari Aster Couldn’t Stand ‘Living in the Internet.’ So He Made a Movie About It
item.description: Ari Aster tells WIRED he wrote Eddington during the height of the pandemic and BLM protests. The Western depicts the explosive consequences of his characters’ conspiracy-fueled social media diets.
